channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Thu, 03 Oct 2024 07:50:05 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Have a right to respond but ...': What Biden said on Israel's retaliatory action after Iran's missile attack
item.description: The US advises Israel to respond cautiously to Iran's missile aggression, urging a proportionate reaction and warning against striking Tehran's nuclear sites. US President Joe Biden and G7 leaders support Israel's right to respond but seek to avoid escalating regional conflict. Meanwhile, Israel's recent airstrike in Beirut has heightened tensions with Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It’s Kam-a-la Harris': CNN anchor gets into heated argument with Trump aide after repeated mispronunciation
item.description: CNN anchor Jim Acosta cut short an interview with Corey Lewandowski after he repeatedly mispronounced Vice President Kamala Harris’ name despite being corrected. The discussion grew heated over various contentious issues including the 2020 presidential election and immigration, leading Acosta to end the exchange abruptly when Lewandowski refused to comply.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Slick talker’ vs ‘school shooter’ gaffe: Walz, Vance trade barbs after policy-focused debate
item.description: Tim Walz and JD Vance engaged in a heated exchange post-debate despite a policy-focused discussion during the vice presidential debate. Vance avoided addressing the 2020 election results, prompting criticism from Walz, who accused Vance of making false claims. Vance focused on attacking Harris for inflation and mocked Walz’s comments on school shooters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Multiple women from anti-vax group allege romantic ties with RFK Jr after Nuzzi scandal
item.description: Three women have alleged romantic relationships with Robert F Kennedy Jr, connected through Children’s Health Defense. Allegations follow an emotional affair with a younger reporter. Kennedy denies the claims. Friends of his wife, Cheryl Hines, suggest she may file for divorce. Allegations could impact Donald Trump's presidential campaign, which Kennedy endorsed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Doctor pleads guilty in 'Friends' star Matthew Perry's drug overdose death
item.description: San Diego doctor Mark Chavez pleads guilty to distributing ketamine to Matthew Perry, contributing to the actor’s fatal overdose. Chavez agrees to cooperate with authorities targeting Dr Salvador Plasencia and dealer Jasmine Sangha, alleged key figures in the illegal drug distribution network.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Russians serve the state: In battle, and in childbirth
item.description: The Kremlin is pushing men to join the army and women to have more children, offering increased sign-up bonuses and financial rewards. Facing a high casualty rate in Ukraine and a declining birthrate, Russia aims to bolster its military and population.

item.title: Prisoner charged after punching therapy dog 'Josie' in Genesee County jail
item.description: An inmate at Genesee County jail allegedly punched a therapy dog named Josie, resulting in a concussion and scrapes. Sheriff Chris Swanson revealed surveillance footage of the incident during a news conference. The suspect, Romello Maxwell, has been charged with aggravated assault, which could lead to a maximum penalty of eight years due to his habitual offender status.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Details don't...': Judge unseals filing detailing Trump’s attempts to overturn 2020 election
item.description: Judge Tanya Chutkan unsealed parts of a filing arguing that former President Trump is not protected by presidential immunity in the effort to overturn the 2020 election. Special Counsel Jack Smith asserts that Trump’s actions were personal, not official. The brief includes key findings, such as Trump’s disregard for Pence’s safety and dismissive reactions to legal advice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 8 Israeli soldiers die in Lebanon as fears of regional war rise
item.description: Iran launched over 180 missiles at Israel, leading to the death of eight Israeli soldiers in Lebanon. Hezbollah claimed the destruction of three Israeli tanks. Israel's PM Netanyahu vowed resistance against Iran. The UN Security Council called an emergency meeting, while G7 leaders urged diplomacy. US President Biden announced upcoming sanctions on Iran.

item.title: Former White House aide slams JD Vance for 'straight up lying' about Trump’s stance on Obamacare
item.description: Former White House aide Alyssa Farah Griffin accused senator JD Vance of lying about Donald Trump’s stance on Obamacare during a discussion on The View. She refuted Vance’s claim that Trump tried to save Obamacare, citing her firsthand experience of their repeal efforts. Griffin also acknowledged Vance’s strong performance in a debate but criticized his honesty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Walz reveals teenage son witnessed St Paul shooting, senator Vance responds with sympathy
item.description: Minnesota governor Tim Walz shared during a debate that his son, Gus, witnessed a traumatic shooting at a St Paul community center. Gus, praised for his composure, helped keep others safe. The shooter was sentenced to 10 years in prison. Walz’s revelation drew sympathy from Senator JD Vance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump mocks Jimmy Carter on his 100th birthday, says Biden replaced him as 'worst president'
item.description: Donald Trump criticised President Joe Biden by comparing him to Jimmy Carter as the "worst president" during a campaign stop. Coinciding with Carter's 100th birthday, Georgia Governor Brian Kemp declared October 1 as “Jimmy Carter Day,” praising Carter's humanitarian contributions despite Trump's remarks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Alaska Fat Bear Week 2024 kicks off: Which bear will reign supreme?
item.description: Voting begins Wednesday for Fat Bear Week at Katmai National Park, celebrating the 10th anniversary of this contest. Fans vote for the fattest brown bears preparing for winter, despite the recent death of Bear 402. The competition includes notable contenders like Grazer, 747, and newly crowned Fat Bear Junior, 909 Jr.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Helene devastates Southeastern US: Biden deploys 1,000 troops for relief efforts
item.description: President Joe Biden has sent 1,000 active-duty soldiers to aid relief efforts in the southeastern US after Hurricane Helene caused over 175 deaths and severe flooding in states like North Carolina and Tennessee. Search teams struggle to reach remote areas, and rebuilding may take years. Survivors can apply for federal assistance to address ongoing challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'F you CBS - how DARE YOU!’: Trump and allies slam moderators for fact-checking and cutting mics during Vance-Walz debate
item.description: CBS moderators Norah O’Donnell and Margaret Brennan faced a decision on fact-checking at the vice-presidential debate. Their occasional interventions led to the muting of microphones during a heated exchange, sparking controversy and accusations of bias from Trump and his supporters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We see no point in dialogue': Russia rejects nuclear talks with US, cites Nato expansion concerns
item.description: Russia has declined to engage in nuclear talks with the United States, citing Nato's expansion into former Soviet regions as a threat to shared security. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov stated that Russia will not negotiate a new treaty to replace the current one expiring in 2026, insisting that any agreement should include additional countries.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tim Walz vs JD Vance: Top memes and jokes from VP debate
item.description: In a key debate before the November 5 election, Republican JD Vance and Democrat Tim Walz, running mates for Trump and Harris respectively, engaged in a lively exchange. The debate stirred considerable reactions on social media, with notable personalities weighing in. Donald Trump and Ben Shapiro were among those who delivered sharp critiques of Walz’s performance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli airstrike targets residential building in Syria's capital Damascus, two killed
item.description: Israel carried out an airstrike on a residential building in Damascus' Mezzah suburb, leading to three deaths and several injuries. The target, associated with Hezbollah and Iranian Revolutionary Guards, marked the second such strike in two days. This escalation follows intensified Israeli operations against Iranian-linked assets in Syria since October 7 Hamas attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Suspicious device made of 'firework components' deactivated by bomb squad in Florida casino
item.description: A second suspicious device was found and safely deactivated at a casino after a thorough search and surveillance review. The Hillsborough County Sheriff’s Office Bomb Disposal Team ensured both devices posed no harm. Authorities continue their investigation, and the casino has reopened safely to the public.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan seeks stability but expects 'China to behave ...': New foreign minister
item.description: Japan's new foreign minister, Takeshi Iwaya, stresses the need for a constructive and stable relationship with China while safeguarding Japan's national interests. He emphasizes dialogue with China, regional peace, and condemns escalating Middle East violence, urging responsible actions from all involved.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
